00011 class core_decode_DPM_t:public core_decode_t
00012 {
00013   enum decode_stall_t {DSTALL_NONE,   /* no stall */
00014                        DSTALL_FULL,   /* first decode stage is full */
00015                        DSTALL_REP,    /* REP inst waiting for microsequencer */
00016                        DSTALL_UROM,   /* big flow waiting for UROM */
00017                        DSTALL_SMALL,  /* available decoder is too small */
00018                        DSTALL_EMPTY,  /* no insts to decode */
00019                        DSTALL_PHANTOM,/* front-end predicted taken when no branch was present */
00020                        DSTALL_TARGET, /* target correction flushed remaining insts (only occurs when target_stage == crack_stage-1) */
00021                        DSTALL_MAX_BRANCHES, /* exceeded maximum number of branches decoded per cycle */
00022                        DSTALL_num
00023                       };
00024 
00025   public:
00026 
00027   /* constructor, stats registration */
00028   core_decode_DPM_t(struct core_t * const core);
00029   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00030   virtual void update_occupancy(void);
00031 
00032   virtual void step(void);
00033   virtual void recover(void);
00034   virtual void recover(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00035 
00036   /* interface functions for alloc stage */
00037   virtual bool uop_available(void);
00038   virtual struct uop_t * uop_peek(void);
00039   virtual void uop_consume(void);
00040 
00041   protected:
00042 
00043   struct Mop_t *** pipe; /* the actual decode pipe */
00044   int * occupancy;
00045 
00046   struct uop_t ** uopQ; /* sits between decode and alloc */
00047   int uopQ_head;
00048   int uopQ_tail;
00049   int uopQ_num;
00050   int uopQ_eff_num;
00051 
00052   static const char * decode_stall_str[DSTALL_num];
00053 
00054   enum decode_stall_t check_target(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00055   bool check_flush(const int stage, const int idx);
00056   void recover_decode_pipe(const struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00057   void recover_decode_pipe(void);
00058   void recover_uopQ(const struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00059   void recover_uopQ(void);
00060 };
00061 
00062 const char * core_decode_DPM_t::decode_stall_str[DSTALL_num] = {
00063   "no stall                   ",
00064   "next decode stage is full  ",
00065   "REP inst waiting for MS    ",
00066   "long flow waiting for UROM ",
00067   "available decoder too small",
00068   "no insts to decode         ",
00069   "phantom taken branch       ",
00070   "target correction          ",
00071   "branch decode limit        ",
00072 };
00073 
00074 core_decode_DPM_t::core_decode_DPM_t(struct core_t * const arg_core):
00075   uopQ_head(0), uopQ_tail(0), uopQ_num(0), uopQ_eff_num(0)
00076 {
00077   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = arg_core->knobs;
00078   core = arg_core;
00079 
00080   if(knobs->decode.depth <= 0)
00081     fatal("decode pipe depth must be > 0");
00082 
00083   if((knobs->decode.width <= 0) || (knobs->decode.width > MAX_DECODE_WIDTH))
00084     fatal("decode pipe width must be > 0 and < %d (change MAX_DECODE_WIDTH if you want more)",MAX_DECODE_WIDTH);
00085 
00086   if(knobs->decode.target_stage <= 0 || knobs->decode.target_stage >= knobs->decode.depth)
00087     fatal("decode target resteer stage (%d) must be > 0, and less than decode pipe depth (currently set to %d)",knobs->decode.target_stage,knobs->decode.depth);
00088 
00089   /* if the pipe is N wide, we assume there are N decoders */
00090   pipe = (struct Mop_t***) calloc(knobs->decode.depth,sizeof(*pipe));
00091   if(!pipe)
00092     fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe");
00093 
00094   for(int i=0;i<knobs->decode.depth;i++)
00095   {
00096     pipe[i] = (struct Mop_t**) calloc(knobs->decode.width,sizeof(**pipe));
00097     if(!pipe[i])
00098       fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe stage");
00099   }
00100 
00101   occupancy = (int*) calloc(knobs->decode.depth,sizeof(*occupancy));
00102   if(!occupancy)
00103     fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe occupancy array");
00104 
00105   knobs->decode.max_uops = (int*) calloc(knobs->decode.width,sizeof(*knobs->decode.max_uops));
00106   if(!knobs->decode.max_uops)
00107     fatal("couldn't calloc decode.max_uops");
00108   if(knobs->decode.width != knobs->decode.num_decoder_specs)
00109     fatal("number of decoder specifications must be equal to decode pipeline width");
00110   for(int i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00111     knobs->decode.max_uops[i] = knobs->decode.decoders[i];
00112 
00113   uopQ = (struct uop_t**) calloc(knobs->decode.uopQ_size,sizeof(*uopQ));
00114   if(!uopQ)
00115     fatal("couldn't calloc uopQ");
00116 
00117   if(knobs->decode.fusion_none)
00118     knobs->decode.fusion_mode = 0x00000000;
00119   else if(knobs->decode.fusion_all)
00120     knobs->decode.fusion_mode = 0xffffffff;
00121   else
00122   {
00123     knobs->decode.fusion_mode = FUSION_NONE;
00124     if(knobs->decode.fusion_load_op)
00125       knobs->decode.fusion_mode |= FUSION_LOAD_OP;
00126     if(knobs->decode.fusion_sta_std)
00127       knobs->decode.fusion_mode |= FUSION_STA_STD;
00128     if(knobs->decode.fusion_partial)
00129       knobs->decode.fusion_mode |= FUSION_PARTIAL;
00130   }
00131 }

00133 void
00134 core_decode_DPM_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00135 {
00136   char buf[1024];
00137   char buf2[1024];
00138   struct thread_t * arch = core->current_thread;
00139 
00140   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### DECODE STATS ####");
00141   sprintf(buf,"c%d.target_resteers",arch->id);
00142   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "decode-time target resteers", &core->stat.target_resteers, core->stat.target_resteers, NULL);
00143   sprintf(buf,"c%d.phantom_resteers",arch->id);
00144   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "decode-time phantom resteers", &core->stat.phantom_resteers, core->stat.phantom_resteers, NULL);
00145   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_insn",arch->id);
00146   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of instructions decodeed", &core->stat.decode_insn, core->stat.decode_insn, NULL);
00147   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_uops",arch->id);
00148   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of uops decodeed", &core->stat.decode_uops, core->stat.decode_uops, NULL);
00149   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_eff_uops",arch->id);
00150   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of effective uops decodeed", &core->stat.decode_eff_uops, core->stat.decode_eff_uops, NULL);
00151   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_IPC",arch->id);
00152   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.decode_insn/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00153   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "IPC at decode", buf2, NULL);
00154   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_uPC",arch->id);
00155   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.decode_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00156   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "uPC at decode", buf2, NULL);
00157   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_euPC",arch->id);
00158   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.decode_eff_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00159   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "effective uPC at decode", buf2, NULL);
00160   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_occupancy",arch->id);
00161   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total uopQ occupancy", &core->stat.uopQ_occupancy, core->stat.uopQ_occupancy, NULL);
00162   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_eff_occupancy",arch->id);
00163   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total uopQ effective occupancy", &core->stat.uopQ_eff_occupancy, core->stat.uopQ_eff_occupancy, NULL);
00164   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_empty",arch->id);
00165   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles uopQ was empty", &core->stat.uopQ_empty_cycles, core->stat.uopQ_empty_cycles, NULL);
00166   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_full",arch->id);
00167   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles uopQ was full", &core->stat.uopQ_full_cycles, core->stat.uopQ_full_cycles, NULL);
00168   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_avg",arch->id);
00169   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.uopQ_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00170   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average uopQ occupancy", buf2, NULL);
00171   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_eff_avg",arch->id);
00172   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.uopQ_eff_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00173   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average uopQ effective occupancy", buf2, NULL);
00174   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_frac_empty",arch->id);
00175   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.uopQ_empty/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00176   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles uopQ was empty", buf2, NULL);
00177   sprintf(buf,"c%d.uopQ_frac_full",arch->id);
00178   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.uopQ_full/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00179   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles uopQ was full", buf2, NULL);
00180 
00181   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_stall",core->current_thread->id);
00182   core->stat.decode_stall = stat_reg_dist(sdb, buf,
00183                                            "breakdown of stalls at decode",
00184                                            /* initial value */0,
00185                                            /* array size */DSTALL_num,
00186                                            /* bucket size */1,
00187                                            /* print format */(PF_COUNT|PF_PDF),
00188                                            /* format */NULL,
00189                                            /* index map */decode_stall_str,
00190                                            /* print fn */NULL);
00191   
00192 }
00193 
00194 void core_decode_DPM_t::update_occupancy(void)
00195 {
00196     /* uopQ */
00197   core->stat.uopQ_occupancy += uopQ_num;
00198   core->stat.uopQ_eff_occupancy += uopQ_eff_num;
00199   if(uopQ_num >= core->knobs->decode.uopQ_size)
00200     core->stat.uopQ_full_cycles++;
00201   if(uopQ_num <= 0)
00202     core->stat.uopQ_empty_cycles++;
00203 }
00204 
00205 
00206 /*************************/
00207 /* MAIN DECODE FUNCTIONS */
00208 /*************************/
00209 
00210 /* Helper functions to check for BAC-related resteers */
00211 
00212 /* Check an individual Mop to see if it's next target is correct/reasonable, and
00213    recover if necessary. */
00214 enum core_decode_DPM_t::decode_stall_t
00215 core_decode_DPM_t::check_target(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00216 {
00217   if(!Mop->decode.is_ctrl)
00218   {
00219     /* next-PC had better be the next sequential inst */
00220     if(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != (Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len))
00221     {
00222       /* it's not (phantom taken branch), so resteer */
00223       ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.phantom_resteers++;)
00224       core->oracle->recover(Mop);
00225       recover_decode_pipe(Mop);
00226       Mop->fetch.pred_NPC = Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len;
00227       core->fetch->recover(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC);
00228       return DSTALL_PHANTOM;
00229     }
00230   }
00231   else /* branch or REP */
00232   {
00233     if((Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != (Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len)) /* branch is predicted taken */
00234         || (Mop->decode.opflags | F_UNCOND))
00235     {
00236       if(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != Mop->decode.targetPC) /* wrong target */
00237       {
00238         if(Mop->fetch.bpred_update)
00239           core->fetch->bpred->recover(Mop->fetch.bpred_update,/*taken*/1);
00240         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.target_resteers++;)
00241         core->oracle->recover(Mop);
00242         recover_decode_pipe(Mop);
00243         core->fetch->recover(Mop->decode.targetPC);
00244         Mop->fetch.pred_NPC = Mop->decode.targetPC;
00245         return DSTALL_TARGET;
00246       }
00247     }
00248   }
00249   return DSTALL_NONE;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /* Perform branch-address calculation check for a given decode-pipe stage
00253    and Mop position. */
00254 bool core_decode_DPM_t::check_flush(const int stage, const int idx)
00255 {
00256   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00257   /* stage-1 because we assume the following checks are acted upon only after
00258      the instruction has spent a cycle in the corresponding pipeline stage. */
00259   struct Mop_t * Mop = pipe[stage-1][idx];
00260   enum decode_stall_t stall_reason;
00261 
00262   if(Mop)
00263   {
00264     if((stage-1) == knobs->decode.target_stage)
00265     {
00266       if((stall_reason = check_target(Mop)))
00267       {
00268         pipe[stage][idx] = pipe[stage-1][idx];
00269         pipe[stage-1][idx] = NULL;
00270         if(pipe[stage][idx]) {
00271           occupancy[stage]++;
00272           occupancy[stage-1]--;
00273           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] <= knobs->decode.width,false);
00274           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage-1] >= 0,false);
00275         }
00276         ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.decode_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00277 #ifdef ZTRACE
00278         ztrace_print(Mop,"d|target-check|mispred target resteer");
00279 #endif
00280         return true;
00281       }
00282     }
00283   }
00284 
00285   return false;
00286 }
00287 
00288 
00289 /* attempt to send uops to the uopQ, shuffle other Mops down the decode pipe, read Mops from IQ */
00290 void core_decode_DPM_t::step(void)
00291 {
00292   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00293   int stage, i;
00294   enum decode_stall_t stall_reason = DSTALL_NONE;
00295 
00296   /* move decoded uops to uopQ */
00297   stage = knobs->decode.depth-1;
00298   if(occupancy[stage])
00299     for(i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00300     {
00301       if(pipe[stage][i])
00302       {
00303         while(uopQ_num < knobs->decode.uopQ_size)   /* while uopQ is not full */
00304         {
00305           struct Mop_t * Mop = pipe[stage][i];      /* Mop in current decoder */
00306           struct uop_t * uop = &Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_stage_index]; /* first non-queued uop */
00307           Mop->decode.last_stage_index += uop->decode.has_imm ? 3 : 1;  /* increment the uop pointer to next uop */
00308           
00309           zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_STORE)) || uop->decode.is_std,(void)0);
00310           zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_LOAD)) || uop->decode.is_load,(void)0);
00311 
00312           if((!uop->decode.in_fusion) || uop->decode.is_fusion_head) /* don't enqueue fusion body */
00313           {
00314             uopQ[uopQ_tail] = uop;      /* queue the uop */
00315             uopQ_tail = modinc(uopQ_tail,knobs->decode.uopQ_size); //(uopQ_tail+1) % knobs->decode.uopQ_size;
00316             uopQ_num++;
00317             if(uop->decode.is_fusion_head)
00318               uopQ_eff_num += uop->decode.fusion_size;
00319             else
00320               uopQ_eff_num++;
00321             ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.decode_uops++;)
00322 #ifdef ZTRACE
00323             ztrace_print(uop,"d|uopQ|enqueue");
00324 #endif
00325           }
00326 #ifdef ZTRACE
00327           else
00328             ztrace_print(uop,"d|uopQ|enqueue fused body");
00329 #endif
00330           ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.decode_eff_uops++;)
00331           uop->timing.when_decoded = sim_cycle;
00332           if(uop->decode.BOM)
00333             uop->Mop->timing.when_decode_started = sim_cycle;
00334           if(uop->decode.EOM)
00335             uop->Mop->timing.when_decode_finished = sim_cycle;
00336 
00337           if(Mop->decode.last_stage_index >= Mop->decode.flow_length)
00338           {
00339             if(Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_uop_index].decode.EOM)
00340               ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.decode_insn++;)
00341             /* all uops dispatched, remove from decoder */
00342             pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00343             occupancy[stage]--;
00344             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00345 #ifdef ZTRACE
00346             ztrace_print(Mop,"d|decode-pipe|dequeue");
00347 #endif
00348             break;
00349           }
00350         }
00351         if(uopQ_num >= knobs->decode.uopQ_size)
00352           break; /* uopQ is full */
00353       }
00354     }
00355 
00356   /* walk pipe backwards up to and but not including the first stage*/
00357   for(stage=knobs->decode.depth-1; stage > 0; stage--)
00358   {
00359     if(0 == occupancy[stage]) /* implementing non-serpentine pipe (no compressing) - can't advance until stage is empty */
00360     {
00361       zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] == 0,(void)0);
00362       tick_t when_MS_started = pipe[stage-1][0] ? pipe[stage-1][0]->timing.when_MS_started : 0;
00363       if((when_MS_started != TICK_T_MAX) && (when_MS_started >= sim_cycle)) /* checks for non-zero MS/uROM delay */
00364         break;
00365 
00366       /* move everyone from previous stage forward */
00367       if(occupancy[stage-1])
00368         for(i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00369         {
00370           if(check_flush(stage,i))
00371             return;
00372 
00373           pipe[stage][i] = pipe[stage-1][i];
00374           pipe[stage-1][i] = NULL;
00375           if(pipe[stage][i]) {
00376             occupancy[stage]++;
00377             occupancy[stage-1]--;
00378             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] <= knobs->decode.width,(void)0);
00379             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage-1] >= 0,(void)0);
00380           }
00381         }
00382     }
00383   }
00384 
00385   /* process the first stage, which reads Mops from the IQ */
00386   /* we're moving instructions into the decoder.  decoder must be able to handle the Mop */
00387   {
00388     if(!core->fetch->Mop_available())
00389     {
00390       stall_reason = DSTALL_EMPTY;
00391     }
00392     else
00393     {
00394       int Mops_decoded = 0;
00395       int branches_decoded = 0;
00396       for(i=0;(i<knobs->decode.width) && core->fetch->Mop_available();i++)
00397       {
00398         if(pipe[0][i] == NULL) /* decoder available */
00399         {
00400           struct Mop_t * IQ_Mop = core->fetch->Mop_peek();
00401 
00402           if(IQ_Mop->decode.is_ctrl && knobs->decode.branch_decode_limit && (branches_decoded >= knobs->decode.branch_decode_limit))
00403           {
00404             stall_reason = DSTALL_MAX_BRANCHES;
00405             break;
00406           }
00407 
00408           if(0==i) /* special case first decoder since it can access the uROM and MS */
00409           {
00410             /* consume the Mop from the IQ */
00411             pipe[0][i] = IQ_Mop;
00412             occupancy[0]++;
00413             zesto_assert(occupancy[0] <= knobs->decode.width,(void)0);
00414             core->fetch->Mop_consume();
00415             Mops_decoded++;
00416 
00417 #ifdef ZTRACE
00418             ztrace_print(IQ_Mop,"d|decode-pipe|enqueue");
00419 #endif
00420 
00421             /* does this Mop need help from the MS? */
00422             if((knobs->decode.max_uops[i] && (pipe[0][i]->stat.num_uops > knobs->decode.max_uops[i])) ||
00423                 pipe[0][i]->fetch.inst.rep)
00424               pipe[0][i]->timing.when_MS_started = sim_cycle + knobs->decode.MS_latency; /* all other insts (non-MS) have this timestamp default to TICK_T_MAX */
00425             if(IQ_Mop->decode.is_ctrl)
00426               branches_decoded++;
00427           }
00428           else /* other decoders must check uop limits */
00429           {
00430             if((!knobs->decode.max_uops[i] || (IQ_Mop->stat.num_uops <= knobs->decode.max_uops[i])) &&
00431                 !IQ_Mop->fetch.inst.rep) /* decoder0 handles reps */
00432             {
00433               /* consume the Mop from the IQ */
00434               pipe[0][i] = IQ_Mop;
00435               occupancy[0]++;
00436               zesto_assert(occupancy[0] <= knobs->decode.width,(void)0);
00437               core->fetch->Mop_consume();
00438               Mops_decoded++;
00439               if(IQ_Mop->decode.is_ctrl)
00440                 branches_decoded++;
00441 #ifdef ZTRACE
00442               ztrace_print(IQ_Mop,"d|decode-pipe|enqueue");
00443 #endif
00444             }
00445             else
00446             {
00447               if(IQ_Mop->fetch.inst.rep)
00448                 stall_reason = DSTALL_REP;
00449               else if((IQ_Mop->stat.num_uops < knobs->decode.max_uops[0]) && knobs->decode.max_uops[0])
00450                 stall_reason = DSTALL_SMALL; /* flow too big for current decoder, but small enough for complex decoder */
00451               else
00452                 stall_reason = DSTALL_UROM;
00453               break; /* can't advance Mop, wait 'til next cycle to try again */
00454             }
00455           }
00456         }
00457         if(Mops_decoded == 0)
00458           stall_reason = DSTALL_FULL;
00459       }
00460     }
00461   }
00462 
00463   ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.decode_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00464 }
00465 
00466 void
00467 core_decode_DPM_t::recover(void)
00468 {
00469   recover_uopQ();
00470   recover_decode_pipe();
00471 }
00472 
00473 void
00474 core_decode_DPM_t::recover(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00475 {
00476   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00477   /* walk pipe from youngest uop blowing everything away,
00478      stop if we encounter the recover-Mop */
00479   for(int stage=0;stage<knobs->decode.depth;stage++)
00480   {
00481     if(occupancy[stage])
00482       for(int i=knobs->decode.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00483       {
00484         if(pipe[stage][i])
00485         {
00486           if(pipe[stage][i] == Mop)
00487             return;
00488           else
00489           {
00490             pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00491             occupancy[stage]--;
00492             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00493           }
00494         }
00495       }
00496   }
00497   recover_uopQ(Mop);
00498 }
00499 
00500 /* start from most speculative; stop if we find the Mop */
00501 void
00502 core_decode_DPM_t::recover_uopQ(const struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00503 {
00504   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00505 
00506   while(uopQ_num)
00507   {
00508     int index = moddec(uopQ_tail,knobs->decode.uopQ_size); //(uopQ_tail-1+knobs->decode.uopQ_size) % knobs->decode.uopQ_size;
00509     if(uopQ[index]->Mop == Mop)
00510       return;
00511     if(uopQ[index]->decode.is_fusion_head)
00512       uopQ_eff_num -= uopQ[index]->decode.fusion_size;
00513     else
00514       uopQ_eff_num --;
00515     uopQ_num--;
00516     uopQ[index] = NULL;
00517     uopQ_tail = index;
00518   }
00519   uopQ_eff_num = 0;
00520 }
00521 
00522 /* blow away the entire uopQ */
00523 void
00524 core_decode_DPM_t::recover_uopQ(void)
00525 {
00526   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00527 
00528   /*
00529   while(uopQ_num)
00530   {
00531     int index = moddec(uopQ_tail,knobs->decode.uopQ_size); //(uopQ_tail-1+knobs->decode.uopQ_size) % knobs->decode.uopQ_size;
00532     uopQ[index] = NULL;
00533     uopQ_tail = index;
00534     uopQ_num--;
00535   }
00536   */
00537   memzero(uopQ,sizeof(*uopQ)*knobs->decode.uopQ_size);
00538   uopQ_head = 0;
00539   uopQ_tail = 0;
00540   uopQ_num = 0;
00541   uopQ_eff_num = 0;
00542 }
00543 
00544 void
00545 core_decode_DPM_t::recover_decode_pipe(const struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00546 {
00547   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00548   /* walk pipe from youngest uop blowing everything away,
00549      stop if we encounter the recover-Mop */
00550   for(int stage=0;stage<knobs->decode.depth;stage++)
00551   {
00552     if(occupancy[stage])
00553       for(int i=knobs->decode.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00554       {
00555         if(pipe[stage][i])
00556         {
00557           if(pipe[stage][i] == Mop)
00558             return;
00559           else
00560           {
00561             pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00562             occupancy[stage]--;
00563             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00564           }
00565         }
00566       }
00567   }
00568 }
00569 
00570 /* same as above, but blow away the entire decode pipeline */
00571 void
00572 core_decode_DPM_t::recover_decode_pipe(void)
00573 {
00574   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00575   for(int stage=0;stage<knobs->decode.depth;stage++)
00576   {
00577     if(occupancy[stage])
00578       for(int i=knobs->decode.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00579       {
00580         if(pipe[stage][i])
00581         {
00582           pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00583           occupancy[stage]--;
00584           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00585         }
00586       }
00587     zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] == 0,(void)0);
00588   }
00589 }
00590 
00591 bool core_decode_DPM_t::uop_available(void)
00592 {
00593   return uopQ_num > 0;
00594 }
00595 
00596 struct uop_t * core_decode_DPM_t::uop_peek(void)
00597 {
00598   return uopQ[uopQ_head];
00599 }
00600 
00601 void core_decode_DPM_t::uop_consume(void)
00602 {
00603   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00604   struct uop_t * uop = uopQ[uopQ_head];
00605   uopQ[uopQ_head] = NULL;
00606   uopQ_num --;
00607   if(uop->decode.is_fusion_head)
00608     uopQ_eff_num -= uop->decode.fusion_size;
00609   else
00610     uopQ_eff_num --;
00611   uopQ_head = modinc(uopQ_head,knobs->decode.uopQ_size); //(uopQ_head+1)%knobs->decode.uopQ_size;
00612 }
